title: Socioconstructivist and UDL-Based Instructional Design for Online Blended Mathematics Education

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational mathematics concepts and classroom teaching experience
context.additional_context: For current secondary mathematics teachers, emphasizing real-life problem-solving skills through project-based assessments in BYOD environments

learning_goals: Learners can design online mathematics instructional materials applying the three UDL principles (engagement, representation, and action & expression).
Learners can facilitate social constructivist-based mathematics discussion activities using Zoom breakout rooms and LMS collaborative tools.
Learners can develop hybrid project-based assignments combining digital tools with traditional assessment methods.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
